(43) 578.20th December, 1943.WAR CABINET.REDISTRIBUTION OF MAN-POWER. 1st APRIL TO 31st OCTOBER.1943.Memorandum by the Minister of Labour and National Service.1. This report for October is in continuation of my reports for August and september (W.P. (43) 454 and W.P. (43) 511) made in accordance with para-graph (14) W.M. (43) 102nd Conclusions, Minute 1 (22nd. July, 1943). '2. The intake and net increases approved for the Forces and for Industryrespectively were given in W.P. (43) 454, paras. 3 and 5. Since the allocationsfor the Forces were approved, certain adjustments have been agreed betweenthe Service Departments and decisions have been given as to certain classes whichshould not count against the allocations. While it has not been possible to take account of all these changes and adjustments in the intake figures given belowfor particular periods, the necessary corrections have been made in arriving at the balances of the allocations for the period the 1st November to 31st December, 1943.Intake into the Forces.3. The War Cabinet directed that the numbers of full-time workers in civil defence (including Police and, National Fire Service) should be reduced by afurther 15,000 before the end of 1943, in addition to the reduction of 75,000 from the 30th June, 1942, previously approved. This gave a total reduction of 90,000to be effected between the 30th June, 1942, and the 31st December, 1943. For themonth of October there was a reduction of 5,300, making the decrease up to the31st October, 1943, 77,600 and leaving a balance of 12,400.E.
